sentence.Network_en: No one can flout the rules and get away with it.
sentence.Network_cn: 谁也不能违反这些规则而不被处分.

sentence.Network_en: Timeshare companies also come in for a rap as they continue to flout the rules.
sentence.Network_cn: 各分时度假公司也受到了批评，因为他们一直违反相关规则。

list.abs: Meanwhile , corruption flourishes , and local officials openly flout environmental laws and regulations ., 与此同时 , 腐败盛行 , 地方官员公然蔑视环境保护法和相关规章制度.
Flout a law ; behavior that flouted convention ., 无视法律 ; 违抗传统的行为.
flouting social norms in matters of attire ., 嘲笑社会上的穿着规范.
yet people flout them more than any other laws of the land .然而，人们最蔑视的法律就是交通法规。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: perhaps from Dutch fluiten 'whistle, play the flute, hiss (in derision'); German dialect pfeifen auf, literally 'pipe at', has a similar extended meaning

entry.def: If you flout something such as a law, an order, or an accepted way of behaving, you deliberately do not obey it or follow it.

example.ex: ...illegal campers who persist in flouting the law...
example.tran: 一向对法律熟视无睹的非法露营者

example.ex: Building regulations have been habitually flouted.
example.tran: 建筑法规一向都无人遵守。

means.word_mean: 2. laugh at with contempt and derision;

auth_sentence.content: She said Iran continues to flout its international obligations.
auth_sentence.res_content: She said Iran continues to flout its international obligations.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She said Iran continues to flout its international obligations.

auth_sentence.content: Those who live loosely and flout the laws.

auth_sentence.content: Ah, you may flout and turn up your faces.
